case.name: Australian Securities & Investments Commission v Pappas [2006] FCA 1785 (20 December 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: penalty to reflect seriousness of the matter
penalty to deter defendant from repeating a contempt and deter others

citances.sentence: 1 On 20 December 2006 I published my reasons for concluding that the defendant should be found guilty on three charges of contempt (see Australian Securities & Investments Commission v Pappas [2006] FCA 1785]). The present reasons should be understood in the light of and as an extension of those reasons. On 20 December 2006, I gave directions for the parties to make submissions on the appropriate penalty for contempt. I have now received written submissions on behalf of the Australian Securities & Investments Commission (the Commission) and the defendant and have heard oral submissions on behalf of both parties on that question.
